yea but i have seen existing avante with those n-line bodykits
Komoco didn't offer n line avantes in Singapore
Aftermarket means not legal in sg?
As long as they conform to width and height regulations
But just rare to get in singapore?
More rare compared to a stock avante? Yes.
But rare in terms or hard to get? No.
Go to any bodykit shop and they can usually order one in for you and install with paint
The rare/hard to get bodykits are those that are custom ones like a liberty walk kit or customer widebody kits
Takes longer to order and get those in and costs much more
Regular upkits for Hyundai n line  Merc AMG upkit  bmw m upkits  Audi RS kits are quite common
Customized bodykits cost more compared to universal kits.
And you don't have one vendor to choose from as many copy the same kit and sell as well
if u got the budget  go for customised. looks nicer
i usually see CN7 with universal
so seeing one w a customised might just turn some heads haha
Yea I think N line bodykit is chio enough
Yes because anything more a bit much already
